rows.REVISED LABOR CHAIN: Updated sequence. VA builds the first product. CoS raises for holding company.

rows.col_3: Locks M0. Posts VA job. Provides the imagination asset (698-tab Trade already exists).
rows.col_4: Locked thesis. Live VA posting. The system itself.

rows.col_3: Admin execution: screens candidates, files entity, sets up tools. BUT ALSO: becomes the daily interface of the IonWave DAO page. Posts updates. Shows progress. Is the heartbeat.
rows.col_4: Entity filed. Tools set up. CoS pipeline. AND: daily updates on the IonWave spinoff site. Transparent progress visible to the world.
rows.col_5: Supports the hire of Product Person

rows.col_3: Builds two sites. Site 1: IonWave DAO spinoff page — the VA is the interface on this, showing real-time launch progress. Makes it sick, fun, engaging. Site 2: DAO infrastructure company page — shows the system, shows IonWave as first proof, attracts investors for the holding company.
rows.col_4: Two live websites. IonWave spinoff page (VA updates daily). Infrastructure company page (investor-facing, shows the factory).

rows.col_3: Executes the IonWave launch using the Trade. BUT their real project is: the IonWave launch IS the fundraising proof for the holding company. They are running IonWave to demonstrate the system works, which is what raises for the infrastructure company.
rows.col_4: IonWave operational. Revenue starting. Expert sessions complete. AND: investor materials for holding company. Proof that the system works.

rows.col_3: Hired by IonWave CoS. Runs the infrastructure company. Manages the portfolio of spinoffs. Oversees P1/P2/P3 tech roadmap. Recruits operators for future Trades.
rows.col_4: Holding company operational. Second spinoff in pipeline. Tech team hired for P1 (Trade Automation).
rows.col_5: Operators for spinoffs. Engineers for tech roadmap.

rows.col_2: Public. Potential customers, community, early supporters.
rows.col_3: Transparency. Show the world what it looks like to launch a company using this system. Build excitement. Build community. Potentially accept early investment/participation.
rows.col_4: Daily updates from VA. Team forming in real time. Business plan visible. Milestones tracked. "Here is how we are going to launch." Progress bar from thesis to revenue. Like a Boardy-style AI interface — engaging, conversational, not a static page.

rows.col_3: Raise for the holding company. Show IonWave as first proof. Explain the coordination hedgefund thesis. Show the tech roadmap (P1, P2, P3). Show the portfolio vision.
rows.col_4: The coordination hedgefund thesis. IonWave as case study #1. The 3-project tech roadmap. The team. How to participate. Not a pitch deck — a live system you can interact with (Claude demo?).
Low risk, clear tasks, fast payment, portfolio piece, path to ongoing work.

rows.col_2: Contract fee + small equity in IonWave
rows.col_4: Interesting project. Two portfolio pieces. Equity upside if IonWave works.

rows.col_2: Equity in IonWave + potential equity in holding company
rows.col_4: Running a funded business with a pre-built system. If IonWave works AND the holding company raises, they have equity in both.
Ground floor of the factory. Every spinoff adds value. Tech roadmap is the upside multiplier.

rows.col_2: Access to finished Trade + small equity or cash
rows.col_4: Minimal time. Interesting work. The finished model is genuinely useful to them.
Deal flow. Reputation. Carry on a differentiated portfolio.
De-risked D2C investment. Unprecedented operational preparation.
Owning the factory, not the product. Tech moat deepens with each spinoff.
Pre-built machine. Clear path. Highest floor, highest ceiling operator role.
